value.0: Helga turns, bleary-eyed, to face you. "Ye again, is it?" she says, her voice slurred. "What be it now?"

"I don't study them, I just clean them," she asserts. "Ye saw both sides, though, didn't ye? Ye passed through the waters and saw the exhibits on the other side? The Council's pretty proud o' that bit."

"Fie," the woman mutters, "There's always something more to clean." She pulls the message closer to her face and crosses her eyes at it. "Elven," she proclaims at last. "A fool's tongue if I ever knew one."
She sways slightly as she considers your question. "Old Man Nimmermaer might. He be an alchemist and, as such, foolish notions be his bread and butter. He makes his home down by the Barrow Site."
"Yes, yes, ye've already paid. No sense giving me more money, now, is there?" She ponders that a moment, giving it serious credence before swatting at you with a cackle.
"The Guild Council be proud of its history and happy to share it with ye. At a price of 50 guilders, mind ye..."
The Guild Hall seems cluttered and claustrophobic. Beaded with sweat, the older woman before you fusses about the dust and occasionally helps herself to a drink from the ale kegs in the corner.
You finally catch her attention. "If ye be looking for the Council," she slurs, "they be down at the Barrow all night and day, dealing with the kafuffle there."
"Aye, we get a few wandering this far north occasionally. Some be lost, some come for a purpose. In yesterday's Council Meeting, there was talk of a company of soldiers passing through."

"I heard them pass by me shutters but they never stopped in to see the exhibits... Except the one fellow, perhaps he was with them. If so, he stayed behind to chat with me after the others left town."
The old woman's eyes glaze over in the memory. "He was a charmer, he was, even for an elf." She chuckles to herself. "I let him in for half price... He said he was here for the Cavanaugh Stone."
"He was wearing armor, the leathers all polished to white on black, the rivets gleaming golden in the lamplight... I can't say I've ever seen anything quite like it before or since."
"He was wearing armor, the leathers all polished to white on black, the rivets gleaming golden in the lamplight..." The dwarf eyes your equipment curiously. "Like yours, I guess, but... cleaner."
"The elf stayed upstairs in the exhibit hall all night and I must have been sleeping when he left because he was gone by morning when I went up to dust."
"I suppose I can do that for ye," she nods. "The Council keeps them up there so the clan always remembers where it is they come from."
"It costs 50 guilders for folks outside the clan but, if ye be as sweet as the elf, I might let ye in for half that."
The old dwarf's eyes light up within her ash-gray face. "True? Aye we have a whole exhibit on the Stone! If ye seek it, what better a thing to do than to educate yourself all about it?"
"Goodness knows," the woman exclaims. "The Council be like a clutch of geese some days, squawking one to the other. It be something to do with the Cavanaugh Stone is all I know."

"I be Helga Einswater -- spelled with a W, sounds like a V! I keep the Guild Hall in one piece, clean up after the Council Meetings, and see people through the exhibits. 'Older than Boulders,' they call me!"
A look of annoyance crosses her broad features. "What do ye think I mean? Ye've already paid to see them. Go on upstairs and ye'll know what I mean sure enough."
The look of shock that crosses her face almost seems to sober her. "Have ye not heard? We be Brogan's own brood here. There be history in this place and the bedrock beneath it."
"We be long-lived, we Barrow Dwarves, but even we be known to die. If we forget our ancestors and not pay homage to what's past, we'll all but wither away... Even the drink won't save us then."
"The Guild keeps an exhibit hall upstairs so all the clan knows where it be they came from. We let outsiders like ye in too, but only at a price of 50 guilders. Think ye be interested?"
"Are ye sure, <boy/girl>? It be a fine history the Council put up there, with plenty of talk of the Cavanaugh Stone and more."
"Perhaps ye can sell your wares to Angmar, our smithy, and return. It be a fine history the Council put up there, with plenty of talk of the Cavanaugh Stone and more."

Comment.value:
The Difficulty Class (DC) for this action must be manipulated manually. Be sure to change it in both the conversation and the action script accompanying this line.

GENERAL GUIDELINE: A typical DC is the PC's level + 10. Tweak as you see fit.

value.0: <StartAction>[DC: 12]</Start> Choose a tactic to Obtain Favor.
<StartAction>[Failure]</Start> Your spell seems unable to penetrate her red-eyed stupor. "How about 50 guilders, <boy/girl>... I not be as think as ye drunk I am."
<StartAction>[Success]</Start> The old dwarf's eyes begin to cross under the power of your spell. "25 guilders, ye say? Why that sounds a fair price..."
<StartAction>[Invalid Tactic]</Start> Sorry, you are currently unable to cast Charm Person.

<StartAction>[Failure]</Start> The old dwarf cackles at your plea. "Your interest exceeds your purse and your purse exceeds your intellect! I be wise on ye, charmer. It be 50 guilders and nothing less!"
<StartAction>[Success]</Start> She purses her lips. "Fine. Fine! Take advantage of old Helga then, why don't ye! Ye'd think the sun wouldn't set over a measly 25 guilders!"

<StartAction>[Failure]</Start> The old dwarf looks like she's been hit. "Ye be right but... It be by the Council rules. There be nothing an old souse like me can do about it. It be 50 guilders, e'en for ye."
<StartAction>[Success]</Start> The old dwarf looks like she's been hit. "Ye be right but... it be by the Council rules, is all... Oh hog's bother! Here, for a fellow dwarf I'll pitch in half!"
<StartAction>[Invalid Tactic]</Start> Sorry, this character will only express kinship towards someone of the same race.
<StartAction>[Failure]</Start> "The rest of ye ain't worth near as much," she cackles. "50 guilders or nothing, mister."
<StartAction>[Success]</Start> She sneaks you a lecherous grin. "I'll love ye for whatever ye want, mister. Make it 25 guilders then, if we be playing that game."
<StartAction>[Invalid Tactic]</Start> Sorry, this character will only respond to flirtations from the opposite gender.
A sour expression crosses the old woman's face. "And don't ye go trying to get in for half price, either. I've had enough of that kind of chicanery to last a lifetime..."
<StartAction>[Invalid Tactic]</Start> Sorry, you do not have enough gold to get in for half price. Try again when you have at least 25 gold.
"Yes, yes, ye've already paid. No sense giving me more money, now, is there?" She ponders that a moment, giving it serious credence before swatting at you with a cackle.
The old woman pockets your coins and nods towards the stairwell. "Go on up, then, but don't ye make a mess of the exhibits. The Council may have them warded but I still have to clean them."

She rolls her eyes and leans to the right a little. "Eh? Mostly drinking. Boys will be boys, even when they be crusty old farts. As for the drink, I never touch the stuff." She wipes a drip of ale from her chin.
"Me have questions 'bout exhibits."
"I have some questions about the exhibits."
"Me find this message scrawled beside waters."
"I found this message scrawled near the waters."
"You know somebody to figure it out?"
"Know someone who might translate it?"
"Me view exhibits upstairs, yuh?"
"Can I view the upstairs exhibits?"
"Goodbye."
"Any strangers come here lately?"
"Have any strangers been through town lately?"
"Tell me 'bout that guy who stayed."
"That one fellow, tell me about him."
"Me see exhibits, yuh?"
"Can I see the exhibits?"
"Me look for Cavanaugh Stone."
"I'm looking for the Cavanaugh Stone."
"Kafuffle?"
"What kind of... kafuffle?"
"Who you be?"
"Who are you?"
"Exhibit? What you mean by that?"
"Exhibits? What do you mean?"
"Hmph. Me not interested in silly exhibits anyway."
"Sorry, I'm not interested in seeing the exhibits."
"Uh... Me not have enough money right now."
"I don't have enough money right now."
<StartAction>[Obtain Favor]</Start> Try to get in for half price.

Cast Spell Check = 1d20 + ability score modifier + character level

Prereq: Must currently be able to cast designated spell.
Cost: 1 use of designated spell

value.0: <StartAction>[Obtain Favor: Cast Charm Person]</Start> "Uh... Me thinks 25 gold."
<StartAction>[Obtain Favor: Persuade]</Start> "Why education always cost so much?"
<StartAction>[Obtain Favor: Kinship]</Start> "You put price on clan past?"
<StartAction>[Obtain Favor: Flirt]</Start> "You love me for my money, yuh?"

value.0: "Here 50 gold. Me want to see exhibits."
"Here's 50 gold. Let me see the exhibits."
Leave.
"What happen in Council Meetings?"
"What goes on in the Council Meetings?"
